content.content: CREATE2 is useful for state channels so a user is certain that at some point a specific contract can exist at an address which can be calculated beforehand. That this address is created from hashing the current address calling CREATE2, a salt and the deploy bytecode seems logical to me. However, in a constructor (and even when calling the CREATE2 opcode) we can send value together with the deployment bytecode. What was the design choice not to hash the call value?
When that matters, can’t the init code (which is hashed) use VALUE to check the endowment as part of the init code?
